content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String; text_width::Int=10)
    """
    wraps a string to the text width, adding a line break as needed

    :param s: Input string to wrap
    :param text_width: Max width of the text
    :return: String with proper line breaks
    """
    words = split(s, ' ')
    lines = String[]
    current_width = 0
    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        word_length = length(word) + 1
        current_width += word_length

        if current_width > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            # start a new line
            current_line = word
            current_width = word_length
        else
            if length(current_line) > 0
                current_line = string(current_line, ' ', word)
            else
                current_line = string(current_line, word) 
            end
        end
    end
    # pick up any last lines to add to output if present
    if length(current_line) > 0
        push!(lines, current_line);
    end
    return string(lines..., '\n')
end
print(wrap_string("This is a string that is too long to be only one line"))
}
```
This will print:
```
This is a string
that is too long
to be only one
line
```
